H0.text: Wind determines whether precipitation will be in the form of rain or snow.

H1.text: Humidity is the factor that determines whether precipitation will be in the form of rain or snow.

H2.text: Air pressure determines whether precipitation will be in the form of rain or snow.

H3.text: Temperature determines whether precipitation will be in the form of rain or snow.

A4.text: In cold conditions, falls in the form of snow.

A5.text: Rain or drizzle that freezes on contact within a subfreezing air mass is called 'freezing rain' or 'freezing drizzle'.
